feed.title: SAP Community - Data and Analytics
feed.subtitle: Data and Analytics Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Persistence of CDS view created on S4HANA into a separate HANA Database
entry.content:
Dear All,

Is there an option to persist CDS view data in the HANA database when HANA DB is being used as a middleware or data warehouse?

In my scenario, I have legacy data stored in HANA DB and OLTP data in S/4HANA. I would like to create a combined view of both datasets and expose it to SAC. My objective is to establish a mechanism that allows us to create CDS views in S/4HANA and transfer them to another HANA database, which will function as a middleware layer.

In my case, a custom SQL view (ZSQL) has been created in S/4HANA using CDS. How can this view be accessed or persisted in a separate HANA database that is acting as a middleware or data warehouse?
I have two HANA databases: one serving OLAP purposes (data warehouse/middleware) and the other being the S/4HANA OLTP system.

entry.title: Not able to copy data across models with shared dimension using Advanced Formula script(SAC)
entry.content:
Hi,

2 of my models has the same shared(public) dimensions and also different dimensions in it. I am trying to copy data between these 2 models(Measure based) in SAC using Advanced Formula with Link function. The validation is ok without errors but when i run its not copying the data. 

Also I tried using the LINK function in Advanced Formula with different dimensions with no shared(public dimension) in each model and i am able to copy the data between models.

Doesn't SAC supports copying data when there are shared dimension in models with LINK Function to copy the data across models.

Please let me know how to solve this.

entry.title: SAP BDC Demo Environment
entry.content:
Hello All, 

Since the BDC trial version is now available, I’d like to create a demo using it. Could you please guide me on how to enable or build the content? Also, is it possible to showcase a demo using standard content, considering that the source systems are not properly maintained? I’m looking for any way to effectively pitch it to clients. I’m exploring options to work exclusively within BDC AI/ML part. The practice source systems are not properly maintained, making it impractical to establish connections with them. However, intelligent applications or insight apps require both source and target systems to be connected in order to enable the content. Are there any materials or documents available that can guide the implementation of Databricks AI/ML on raw data within an SAP BDC environment?

entry.title: Validation Check for Driver % Summing to 100% by Cost Center in SAC Table via Script
entry.content:
Hi All,

I’m working on a planning scenario in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and need help implementing a validation check on a table.

The table contains driver values that are expected to sum up to 100%, but the key requirement is that this summation must be validated with respect to each cost center, even when the table includes multiple combinations of other dimensions.

Currently, I’ve enabled the "Totals" row in the table, which allows for visual verification, but this doesn’t serve as an actual validation. What I’m looking for is:

A way to check programmatically or through scripting if the driver percentages sum to 100% for each cost center

If the sum is not 100% for any cost center, a popup message or alert should display, identifying which cost centers are affected

     Budget
     2024
     Driver
CostcenterCountryChannelBrandProduct 
CC1Totals   1
CC1#2##0.15
CC1#3##0.75
CC1#4##0.1

Is there any way to achieve this through scripting (e.g., in an analytic application) or through any other built-in SAC functionality?

Any guidance or examples would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Stack Analytical Models
entry.content:
Hi,

 

Recently the feature to stack Analytical models (AM) has been released.


I already see two benefits:

- Data Access Control on first AM (with options to add more detailed DAC on second AM...) 

- Calculations managed on the first AM

 

I was wondering if there are other benefits/ calculations possible due to this new feature?

Would love to know how others see this feature (filtering, restrictions,..) .

 

Kind regards

entry.title: Report TIME in minutes using Story Reports
entry.content: Is there a way to adapt the Story Report Template Time Account Snapshot to report in MINUTES?  It's currently configured to show days and hours.

entry.title: (Datasphere/SAC) Time Dimension attributes not visible in SAC
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I have created an analytical model in Datasphere (DSP). In the underlying fact view, I have created a handful of associations, including an association with the time dimension table created for the space.

Enabling all of the attributes in the DSP Analytical model allows me to see and use them in the Analytical model Preview, SAC Data Analyzer, and in a Table Widget in a SAC story.

But alas! I need them in a chart, where they are not visible. Only the hierarchy I created in the time dimension is available when adding the time dimension to the chart.

entry.title: Recover the original version of the standard content after it was overwritten in SAP
entry.content:
Dear All, 

 

There is standard IFP business content available in the public folder of SAP SAC . I had reimported this content, but I selected the 'Import' option with overwrite enabled, which replaced the existing content. Now, I want to retrieve the previous version. How can I recover the original content in which I have made changes

entry.title: Sales &and Profitability IFP Calculating Sales Deductions
entry.content:
Hello All,

I hope you're doing well.

I'm currently working on creating a customized Sales & Profitability module by replicating certain dimensions and measures from the standard Integrated Financial Planning (IFP) content into a dummy planning model for demo purposes.

While calculating Net Sales using the formula:
Net Sales = Gross Revenue – Sales Deductions,
I'm facing a challenge specific to the textile industry scenario I'm planning for.

The issue lies in the commission component of Sales Deductions, which varies by customer and product (Dimensions). For example, Customer A may have a 5% commission rate, while Customer B may have 6%. This variability impacts the net sales calculation.

Could anyone please guide me on how to incorporate customer-specific commission rates into the planning model to accurately calculate Net Sales per customer? do I need to create a separate model for that, data blending capabilities, or be able to incorporate that logic in the data action of main model instead of creating another model

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Report on percentage billing on each project in a month
entry.content:
We are trying to build a story report to capture percentage of total billing an employee has done on a project in a given month

User IDProject nameNumber of hours billed Percentage
1xa(a/(a+b+c))*100
1xb(b/(a+b+c))*100
1yc 
2yd((d/(d+e)*100)
2ze 

Here Number of hours billed is a measure , But we are not able to calculate the said percentage because when we trying to create a calculation to  aggregate Number of hours based on user id, the system is returning same values as in number of hours in the calculation.

 

Can someone help in creating this calculation. Aggegation on aggregation

entry.title: SAC Agent Hosting for Azure MSSQL Connection
entry.content:
Hi team,

I’m reaching out following a request from a partner regarding SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) integration.

We need to connect SAC to an Azure-hosted MSSQL database, which—as I understand from the team—requires running a SAC agent. My partner's previous experience with RISE allowed them to host the SAC agent directly on the RISE infrastructure, assuming it was included in the BOM.

Now, they’re looking at the GROW setup.

Is the same approach possible with GROW? Can the SAC agent be hosted on GROW infrastructure, or would it need to be self-hosted in this scenario?

If anyone has experience or advice on this topic, especially regarding GROW vs. RISE for SAC agent hosting, I’d really appreciate your insights.

entry.title: How to keep a dimension up to date without reloading the entire data history
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have an import model in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) that includes several public dimensions, such as “Customer” and “Vendor.” The model contains about 15 years of data, with approximately 2 million rows per year. Due to the volume and duration of the data load, we only reload the last 2 years, every day

The Data Source is a BW Query. "Vendor" and "Customer" are Public Dimensions.

“Vendor” is an attribute of “Customer” (i.e., “Customer.Vendor”), and as an attribute, it updates automatically. However, we need “Vendor” as a separate dimension for two main reasons: we apply Data Access Control on it, and it contains additional attributes like "zip code", "street" or "phone number".

 

The main issue is that we need a way to keep the “Vendor” dimension current across all records, including historical ones, without reloading all the transactional data. Ideally, we would like to manage this through Master Data updates, but SAC doesn’t seem to support dimension-only updates without a full reload of the underlying transactional data.

Although our specific case involves “Customer” and “Vendor,” the question is more general: is there any way to maintain and update dimensions (not just attributes) in SAC via Master Data, without having to reload the entire transactional model?

Thank you very much in advance,

Jesús

entry.title: Resource Purchase & Consumption IFP Product Costing
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone assist with how we should plan the purchases of raw material resources using the standard product cost content in IFP?

We aim to calculate:
Opening Stock + Purchases – Consumption  = Inventory.

While consumption is easy to derive, determining the required purchases is unclear. Additionally, is there a way in IFP to display the breakdown of change—i.e., show purchases and consumption separately instead of a net change? If so, how can this be achieved? need to show the balances interms of Quantity 

Looking forward to your guidance.

entry.title: MARD and MARC table delta with ABAP CDS Extractor (CDC Enabled) does not work
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

The tables MARC and MARD have a replacement objects in S4HANA. When a ABAP CDS view extractor (CDC enabled) is built on these tables , we have observed that the delta does not work if the record is changed but New records are coming as delta.

How do we handle delta for these tables ? Or do we have any alternate way to get the delta from table MARC and MARD in Datasphere.

Thanks,

Vinay

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Optimized Story Experience API Reference Guide
entry.content:
I have the following problem: I want to get a notification in my story both in the SAC and by mail when I click on a button (function onclick() ).

Here is my code:

 

var user_info = Application.getUserInfo();
console.log(user_info);
 
console.log("Senden beginnen:");
Application.sendNotification({
    "title": "Test",
    "content": "Test2",
    "receivers": [Application.getUserInfo().id],
    "isSendEmail": false
 
}
);
console.log("Senden beendet:");
 
I also have the appropriate authorizations (Runtime notification). Unfortunately, I still don't get a notification and the following exception is thrown in the JS code.

KR

Dominik

entry.title: Can story report widgets be added into the Compensation module like dashboard tiles could?
entry.content:
Hello, 

We're still new and transitioning to Story Reports, do you know if it's possible to load the story report widgets into the Compensation Module Insights like we could with Tile reports? Especially with Dashboards/Tiles deprecating?

Here is a screenshot of where we typically reference the insights within the Executive Review of the Compensation Module:

These are 3 Tile Reports we created in Report Center that get connected to in the Compensation Module:

Any help or advice on how we can provide this similar functionality to the end-user with Story Reports is appreciated!

Thanks!
Geena

entry.title: Allocations distribution logic in SAC Planning Data Action
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I'm working on a planning process in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) that distributes costs based on the number of units per cost center (CECO).

Here’s the logic I’ve implemented:

  • I have a driver table where I input the distribution percentage by channel (e.g., Retail, Wholesale, E-commerce).

 

  • That percentage is then distributed proportionally based on the number of units per CECO.

The issue I’m facing is that if a CECO has no units reported, its portion of the percentage should be redistributed among the remaining CECOs that do have units.

Has anyone implemented a similar logic in a Data Action or Advanced Script in SAC Planning?
Thanks in advance!

entry.title: CDS View I_GLACCOUNTHIERARCHY is empty in SAP S/4HANA (in relation to Finance Foundation in SAC)
entry.content: I have the following problem: SAP DataSphere & SAC Business Content “Finance Foundation for S/4 and S/4 Cloud” (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/6eb1eff34e4c4b1f90adfbfba1334240/ a89082b76bfc1014a79e69594ccc91ad.html?locale=en-US) requires the following CDS view: I_GLACCOUNTHIERARCHY. However, this view is empty in our system. What customizing do I need to fill the view with data? Can anyone help me here?
